website_summaries.verdict: Quirks aside, if you are looking for a camera bag that isn't too large or bulky but will fit most of your gear and your budget, this one is worth considering.
pros: Has a lot to offer considering the low price, including a compact structure that's easy to carry and excellent padding for protecting items
Numerous small compartments make organizing lenses and other accessories easy
cons: Durability concerns such as broken zippers, ripped seams, and torn lining have been occasionally noted after typical use

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag and price!
customer_reviews.text: I gave 4 stars because i havent used it as yet but so far by the looks of it. Its a cool bag. The water resistant cover is conveniently stored in the bottom also couple as a hiding place for small items and it also has a secret pocket at the bottom of the inside strap. Storage is sufficient as i have camera, flash, led lights, extra batteries and storage media and still cant fill the bag. For the price this bag looks good. If i find issues i will update.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Size and compartments are great, quality, not so much. I am very disappointed as I had hoped to take it with me to Canada. The back lining was not completely sewn and one of the pockets was stitched poorly. I'll be sending this one back as I travel alot with my camera, so I can't afford to start off with a bag that isn't good quality.
customer_reviews.author: lego

customer_reviews.title: Good little bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought for travel for my Nikon D3400. Camera and telephoto lens fit fine in main compartment. Plenty of additional little pockets to hold spare battery, sd card, etc. I can't figure out how to configure the dividers that come with it to keep spare lens from rubbing against camera body, seems like a velcro strip is missing, so I keep the spare lens in a small padded bag inside this one. This bag is better than the big bulky bag that came with my camera, but could use a few small design tweeks. Overall, however, happy with bag.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzly mom

customer_reviews.title: Not user-friendly whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Got this product yesterday, quality felt kind of weak at First. Then I had to set it up for my use. Still haven't found a configuration that allows me to separate my camera and lenses properly. ( This part is a true pain in the ass. ) The messenger style shoulder bag is awkward AF, ( I have several other messenger bags that I truly love) however this one is far from Love. This thing would be returned in a heartbeat if it wasn't for my lifestyle, ( cost me more to send it back) you'll find at a local Goodwill near you buyer beware...
customer_reviews.author: John E. Wright Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The Qipi Sling Style Camera Backpack is handy and useful...
customer_reviews.text: Like some of the other reviews have noted, the camera compartment is small, but then I'm using it for day trips and hiking, so I don't need to load it with everything. I usually only carry my camera with a 35mm and zoom lenses, extra battery, cleaning cloth, and my backpack tripod (in the bags outside side pocket and strapped with the bags attached adjustable straps and clasps). My walking stick doubles as my monopod. My large Labbie happily carries our water and snacks in his Saddlebag pack. I've found the Qipi Camera Bag - Sling Style Camera Backpack handy and useful. My dogs saddlebag pack:
customer_reviews.author: Customer 12

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for a long road trip to the mountains. I ended up hiking with it several times. It's a great bag. There's room for five lenses and my camera body (D3400). The smaller pockets have room for a lens brush, an extra battery, my battery charger, an extra card, and my phone. My tripod fit very well on the bag. Now, is it lightweight? Depends on who is using it. I'm 5'1" and am petite. I can carry it for a bit without any problems, but my husband ultimately ends up with it on his back.
customer_reviews.author: Soprano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I lkied that this can hold my Canon 6D with 24-105 mm lens attached in one compartment and in another compartment it holds my large Tamron wide angle 15-30 mm lens. Plus all of my accessories can be accommodated in the remaining compartments including ample space for extra batteries, SD cards, lens cleaning items , a water bottle , etc. Has many straps you can tether the bag to your other luggage, or tether a travel tripod to the bag. In addition you can swing the bag to the front so you don't have to take the bag off your shoulder in order to remove items from it. I highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Yahart53

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag to bring a camera and a spare lens with me to video shoots as well as while out and about for hobby photography. The top area is perfect for audio recording gear and spare batteries, and the main compartment does a good job of securing the camera and lenses. Pleasantly surprised by the solid build quality for the price, and would definitely recommend this camera bag for anyone looking for a smaller size bag for low carry weight and portability. If you're looking to carry multiple cameras or a whole bunch of large lenses this may not be big enough, for what it is it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Not camera friendly
customer_reviews.text: This bag is not camera friendly. Not easy to pull the camera out to take photos. Wish I had returned before putting it to use. Another closet sitter.
customer_reviews.author: Abbygirl

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: I had to send this back. The liner in the bag was not sewn in very well, so that didn't sit well with me. It was coming apart as soon as I started putting items in it. It was just not for me. I wanted something better quality so I sent this back and went another direction.
customer_reviews.author: Richiebee47Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Best camera back pack!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best backpack for camera! Great comparments, so easy to rich your camera. It fits great, amazing for travel! People this is not to carry all your gears, its for a cam and 3 lensses, your phone, keys and some other little things! Great job, I love it, my Nikon, 3 lenses and extension tubes fit perfect and so quick! Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: anca

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, just not for me.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is well constructed and extremely well padded for the camera. I had a couple of reasons to return it: 1. For sports photography, I like to carry a 20-10 and 70-200 lens setup with a full-frame camera. Very hard to get this to fit this bag without jamming both camera and lens in the main compartment. 2. This bag simply had too many compartments. Seems hard for designers to resist the temptation to add another zipper and pocket. This one had pockets everywhere. It was hard to remember which pocket contained which item so I was always fumbling with zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Jagman

customer_reviews.title: NOT good for busty ladies
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this bag for me. It is a great bag, comfortable to wear and fits just the right amount of my equipment. BUT, busty/plus size ladies be warned, this bag is not your friend from an appearance stand point. I just can't get past how stupid this looks on me to wear it in public on my travels. Feel free to get a good laugh at my photo, I know I did. The search continues for my perfect small travel camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Gill

customer_reviews.title: Great camera bag and incredible value.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera bag. I'm not a professional, but this bag holds everything I need: my camera with lens attached, two additional lenses, extra batteries and charger. The padding is adequate and although I haven't dropped the bag but I think it would survive a 10ft fall. The dividers are customizable. It's easy to quickly move the bag front your back to front to change out any gear. My only very minor complaint is the zippers seem to "stick" a little. By that I mean it isn't a smooth motion. Overall, I am incredibly happy with my purchase! If anything happened to this bag, I'd order another the same day without question.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great camera bag
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this bag. I’m a newbie photographer as a hobby do I wAnted affordable but practical. I plan to use at music festivals so I wanted something small. This over the shoulder bag is comfortable. It doesn’t get hot with the vented strap and I like that I can sling it to the front to grab equipment without having to remove the bag. The Velcro spacers are weird but they work. They are very cushioned so I feel all my expensive equip are safe. I plan to get a telescope lens and I’m concerned it’ll be too long but I’ll figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: FeFe Greene

customer_reviews.title: and I can already tell I'm going to love it! Definitely well made
customer_reviews.text: My bag just arrived, and I can already tell I'm going to love it! Definitely well made, good quality. Perfect for a shooter like myself with limited lenses, and wanting a bag I can carry with me easily. Also can be used for hiking which I love. Straps for the tripod can easily be used to hold a water bottle, or there is a pocket on that side as well.
customer_reviews.author: Christine B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sling Bag
customer_reviews.text: I got this Qipi sling bag to carry a little more gear than my Altura sling bag does which I’ve had for a couple of years. The padding on this bag is thick and there are all kinds of small pockets to carry memory cards, cables and batteries. The sewing was done well. The zippers feel slightly more robust on the Altura but these on the Qipi function fine. Interestingly, the lining of both bags is purple. The Altura is a satin-like material while Qipi is a flannel, like fabric typically used in pajamas. I really like the functionality and compact size of a sling bag and this one can easily accommodate an impressive amount of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Stan57Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: On The Go Like Pro
customer_reviews.text: I was in Miami for a photo/video assognmnet and rwalized my current camera bag was not secure nor sufficient for the events I would be attending. I purchased this bag thinking after all of the events is would probably end up in the trash and I would have gotten my money's worth. Well, it did not end up in the garbage. It is an amazing bag. Perfect for front or back packing. Easy to pull out equipment and it has a rain cover which came in handy during the rain. Great value. Excellent quality. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Natasha Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Bag for Travel
customer_reviews.text: I'm a photographer with as many as three heavy cameras to lug around while traveling on foot. This bag is large enough to fit 2 or 3 cameras with accessories and has lots of useful zipper compartments. The materials and build quality are sturdy and stylish. The fit is comfortable, and I like the way it easily slings forward so I can access all the compartments while on foot without taking it off. I liked it so much that I bought a second one to dedicate to my vintage film cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking and light gear.
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok for traveling with a few small lenses and camera. I do like the extra compartments for my filters and batteries. It’s a more compact bag if you want to travel light. My telephoto doesn’t fit well in this bag so I need to have that in a separate bag and that is the only downfall...but for the price of the bag it is nice for light gear especially if your hiking for landscape photos. I did like that it came with a rain cover.
customer_reviews.author: Sweets123

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little bag for tracking around my city. It has room for my camera and 3 manual lenses. I had to return a different bag because it was too small but this one is nearly the same size and fits everything well thanks to its layout. The side pocket is perfect for lenses while the top is much larger than expected and fights my lights and remote well.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Morris

customer_reviews.title: Simple but efficient
customer_reviews.text: Its smaller than it looks. I had room for a nikon d800, a 70-300 and one more small lens. It also had a small pocket for a battery or small accessories. The strap though was long enough to wrap around my large frame, which is what I was looking for in a bag. I'd recommend this bag for simple excursions when you don't need a lot of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Women have these things called boobs, damn designers
customer_reviews.text: Fits everything I need for a mirrorless camera (including 3 lenses), gopro (including microphone, lume cube, mounts) and all batteries, cords, etc. However the straps were NOT designed with women in mind. Hey! Designers! We have things called BOOBS and straps digging in our underboob or for larger breasted women, through the nipple IS NOT COMFORTABLE. I prefer underboob digging to nipple-gouging so the straps are fairly snug... it can work but yikes.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Bag!!️
customer_reviews.text: Great camera bag. I got this when I bought my Lumix G7 camera. Everything fits in with lots and lots of space still available for other equipment like other lenses, etc. Very durable, keeps things protected. I like that at the bottom of the bag, there is a zipper with a waterproof cover for the camera bag...very nice. Overall I'd give the bag an "A" .
customer_reviews.author: Sassy B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and love its versatility.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for my new Mars-lite projector hoping it would work. I am an author and storyteller and I speak to young children in their classrooms - sometimes I need my own projector. This bag did everything I hoped it would. The cushy dividers for the main compartment were easily arranged to safely store the projector. There were more than enough other compartments to store the power cord, remote, etc. It also securely holds my tripod. Love how easy it makes carrying all my goodies with a comfortable shoulder strap to boot! Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Ojedas y Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Extremely and Highly Reccomended!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing camera bag I have ever owned. There is a pocket for everything! I was excited to discover a secret pocket in the bottom of the bag that hold a waterproof cover to keep your bag and camera dry and protected from the elements. For a person who likes adventuring and taking pictures along the way, this bag is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I loaded it with my Canon 7D body, wide angle lens, zoom lens, and one other. All fit very compact and easily accessible. In the zipper pockets I stored my filters, extra battery, and chargers. Worked well. Made for a smaller body to carry it as a sling. Didn't work so well for this body. ;) However, I felt my equipment was safely contained. Zippers and snaps all strong, well made.
customer_reviews.author: Becky T.

customer_reviews.title: I loved the pockets but not the quality.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this backpack for all his pockets. I had to sen ti back necause the interior were you put the camera was super flimsy. I had problems with the shoulder strip too. I am a woman with a bit of breast and I am not small neither. Never have problems with backpacks before but this one it was too tight and not confortable. It felt it was done for men or skinny women with no breast. I really loved the rest, but I had to let it go and get the amazon basics model, more sturdy and confortable with the shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: Jusa

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Fantastic minimalist’s bag. Well constructed with all the necessary compartments and pockets, comfortable, and spacious without large outer dimensions. Carried my Canon 5D and two lenses and all the necessaries with room to spare for two weeks through the canyons of Utah and Arizona. Worked perfectly and with ease. Plan to make it my easy-getaway bag.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon A. Migliore

customer_reviews.title: Great camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my Cannon camera and lenses. The bag that came with camera could not hold extra lenses safely, this one does and more. Son plays college football and bring these to all the games, very easy to open and use lenses. Love that you can make the compartments to the size and fit you need. Love the purple inside.
customer_reviews.author: Four for me

customer_reviews.title: Just the Right Size - Excellent for the Money
customer_reviews.text: The bag is well made and just the right size to accommodate an SLR with three lenses - in my case Canon 6D Mk II, EF 16-35 f/4L, EF 24-70 f/4L, and EF 70-300 f/4-5.6L. See the picture for how I arranged things.. I’m 5’ 11” and the bag fits well across my back fully strapped. There’s additional room in the top section of the bag for other items. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kofi

customer_reviews.title: Great size and shoulder strap options
customer_reviews.text: Took several outings to get used to it, but I like the bag more with every use. There's a couple of ways to place the shoulder strap for comfort or quick release convenience. I like that the size is versatile for long hikes or packed public events. Can't carry all lenses if you have several, but definitely has a large variety of pockets for gear. Glad I took a chance on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable backpack with tons of storage
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is amazing. I bought it because I was sick of carrying my camera around my neck and constantly hitting my kid in the head with it lol. It's so comfortable, I'm 7 months pregnant but I can carry a lot in this bag without getting tired. It has so many pockets, it is great for traveling and carrying passports, cameras, and everything else you need. I don't have an SLR camera, but this is an all around great backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage space
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to this camera bag to hold all of my items in one place for my SLR camera. I wanted something easy to carry that held everything and this does just that. and its lightweight and not bulky. I use my camera for hockey games so didn't want something bulky. Perfect for what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag! Lots of pockets.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag because I don’t carry or need as much gear as I used to. It fits one camera body and two lenses for me with room to add more stuff if needed. Has a lot of pockets to carry your little things. I gave comfort 4 stars because I have large breasts (Gs) and the strap is a little short to get around the girls. So I hand carry it most times. Not a dealbreaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: I_Am_Jane_Doe

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BAG IT FITS EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: This bag offers plenty of storage. As well as a weather proof cover bag and will strap your Tripod right to the side. There is plenty of little pouches to fits things like SD cards and extra batteries. there is also a hidden pocket if you need to carry some extra cash or something you want to keep safe. There is also a pouch on the should strap for you to store your phone so it is always accessible quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Renee

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unconfortable , with the worst camera padding ive seen in quite some time no modularity and very little protection , used it to travel to europe and its unpractical and left me with back pain
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: I just started out with photography, and i did need a bag to carry my camera and small items. For the price i paid i can honestly say this is very useful i take it everywhere i go. Store my camera with lens attatched and 2 separate lense. You can mindfully the mold on how you want since the attachments are Velcro. I do recommend it. Only downfall i wish the inside was black or gray. But that’s it. No complaints on the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Still very small compared to the factory bag my camera came in. I would not suggest it if you have more than 2 lens and a speed light. You'll be packed to the max. There are a ton of cute little compartments for phone, SD cards and so forth if you need them though.
customer_reviews.author: SandySue

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for when you don't need all your gear and won't be wearing the thing all day long. I have it loaded with two Canon 6D bodies, a 16-35, 70-200, hot shoe mount led light panel and all the little stuff I might use. Seems like it should hold up for years and for me its comfortable enough to wear for an hour or so. Nice and compact!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I have used many different styles of ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have used many different styles of bags & holsters over my 30+ years of nature photography and FINALLY a bag that makes sense! Getting to the camera is almost as easy as having it hanging freely but with security and protection when you're out on the trail! I round recommended this highly!
customer_reviews.author: Scott A Block

customer_reviews.title: Great bag if it fits your body type
customer_reviews.text: It is a great, sturdy bag. Loved all the pockets and spaces for camera lenses. Unfortunately, I had to return because the strap was not long enough to fit my body type. At its longest setting it still did not fit comfortably across my body. It is especially uncomfortable/awkward for females who are not flat chested. It just doesn't cut right. When I tried to sling bag to reach things, there was not enough length in the strap for it to move. I do recommend it, though! Just wasn't right for me.
customer_reviews.author: GFrat

customer_reviews.title: Nice, keeps my camera safe and other valuables safe from breaking
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has a lot of padding to keep fragile things cushioned while in transit! I was a little taken aback when I got it because it has Velcro insides which was surprising but in the end I like it that way so I can change the spots to fit my stuff in better!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit like it states
customer_reviews.text: Returned. It did not fit the 70-200 lens like it shows. I tried to put lens and camera as shown in photo and the spacing was different. Did not work like i had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: ThiaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, recommend return or trash.
customer_reviews.text: This comes with dividers, but made cheaply, bend easy, not simple at all to manipulate. The fabric is cheap, ugly, rough texture. The zippers are flimsy, probably break after some moderate usage. Overall this bag is good for laundry, not expensive camera equipment. You're welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Spaghett

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA BAG
customer_reviews.text: I LIKE THE FACT THAT I CAN FLIP AROUND WHILE STILL ON MY BACK, GET THE CAMERA I NEED AND FLIP BACK ON MY BACK WITH OUT TAKING IT OFF. LIKE THE COVER FOR THE BAG IN THE EVENT IT STARTS TO RAIN AS ONE OF MY CAMERAS IS NOT WEATHER SEALED. LOVE THE DIVIDERS INSIDE AS WELL, LOTS OF POCKETS ...THANKS
customer_reviews.author: michael pattison

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Sized Right, Easy Adjust
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and just the right size to carry DSLR camera with one zoom lens. Adjustable to fit smaller or larger chested person easily. Love the snug water bottle holder and cell phone pouch on the shoulder that provides easy access!. Have a few smaller pouches for handy items when you're hiking (like a snack). All in all a great purchase. The sling style was comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Abjoyful

customer_reviews.title: Great bag  idea
customer_reviews.text: We bought a Sony a6000, and we wanted a camera bag that would hold what we needed without feeling like we needed it on wheels. This seems to do the trick. Lots of safety with extra buckles on the camera area so it can not be opened easily. Lots of little pockets to store the ancillary stuff that needs to go with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Fergie

customer_reviews.title: This seems like a good quality bag
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a good quality bag. However, It was not what I was looking for. The pictures do not show that you have to wear a strap on the front of your body ( like around your waist) that buckles to keep the sling in place. Not very comfortable for me. It makes the bag at an awkward angle to open and get the camera out. Good for someone who wants this kind of set up but just a heads up on the whole strap thing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kubiak

customer_reviews.title: Very light and handy for biking or just throwing in the passanger seat.
customer_reviews.text: When I'm on my Trek bike, I can slide this around to the front, grab my camera with hand strap, lift it and shoot without getting off the bike or setting the bag down. ... Then replace the camera, zip it up, slide it around to my back and click ... I'm off. Would probably be a 5 star with just a little more spare lens room.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Drobeck

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for beginners or traveling
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bag! Perfect size for a beginner or a travel bag for trips. I love the color. All the seams and zippers worked properly. The Velcro was strong (almost to the point of frustration trying to configure the bag! Lol!). The cell phone holder held my iPhone X well but I can’t see it holding a iPhone Plus or equivalent sized android. Lots of pockets and places to put stuff. Only thing I wasn’t completely pleased with was the adjustments on the straps. They don’t look like they’ll stay well. I suppose I will see when I go on my trip next week!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well made, lots's of pockets and places to put things. Easy to configure for my cameras, lenses and things. I'm a larger person (6' - 230 lbs) so the straps went to the limit but still comfortable enough. Should be fine for what I plan for. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: R Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, but didn't hold all of my lenses
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing quality, but the main compartment wasn't quite big enough for me. I also didn't like that I had to take off the bag and lay flat to get my stuff in and out or I would risk it all falling out. I did return this for a different style.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M.

customer_reviews.title: You can swing it around to your front for easy access. I've rid myself of heavy DSLR's because ...
customer_reviews.text: This may be the smartest camera bag I have ever owned. It is meant for a mirrorless small camera and can fit two-three extra lenses. You can swing it around to your front for easy access. I've rid myself of heavy DSLR's because my back has begun to rebel and my wisdom (of a certain age) insists on common sense solutions!
customer_reviews.author: NanaTech

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: So far, really like this bag. Fits quite a bit. Needed something to secure my 60d and 2 lenses while hiking and traveling. Liked the sling feature. I agree with other reviews, would be nice to have a little more room to grow on the strap, especially with a bulky coat. Otherwise, an excellent bag. I felt my equipment was secure and could pack what I needed inside.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: I like it, I don't love it
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, I like it. I have a large canon dslr and it does not fit the space I make for it completely. I probably have to do a better job arranging the velcro but... What keeps it from 5 stars? Ergonomics of it maybe??? IDK. I do like it though, and am glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Pookie Finklestein

customer_reviews.title: Many pockets for lenses and tools
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, a bit cumbersome to use. It fits best if carried around to the front of you. All my equipment fits compactly in it with good padding.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Coffee

customer_reviews.title: and this is the best one I have found
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a number of camera bags over the years, and this is the best one I have found. It holds my Nikon 7200 with an 18-300 lens attached, plus room for 2 other lenes and other needed equipment. It cannot hold everything I own for photography, but does hold enough for any trip I am going on, I just pick what I want to put in it.
customer_reviews.author: NLM

customer_reviews.title: It looks small and fits comfortably but when you open it up to see howmuch fits in that bag
customer_reviews.text: I Love this bag! There are so many places for all of my camera accessories, extra batteries, lenses, flashes, memory cards, camera, and even my camera cleaning supplies. It's perfect and just what I need! It looks small and fits comfortably but when you open it up to see howmuch fits in that bag....I feel like Mary Poppins when I pull out so many things from a seemingly small back pack.
customer_reviews.author: Cait_lin

customer_reviews.title: Allows for easy access when Hiking
customer_reviews.text: I use this when going on hikes and need something secure and light for taking pictures on the go. I'm able to hold three lenses and the body of the camera, there are so many additional pockets that allow for excess storage space and a phone pocket in the front strap. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DLamb

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need for my DJI Mavic Pro drone
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to have a small bag for my DJI Mavic Pro drone to carry with me wherever I go. I looked all over the internet, and came across a couple of sling bags, but then I decided to go with this one. I'm glad I ended up buying this bag. The price is very good, the bag looks awesome, and it has a lot of mini pockets. I highly recommend this bag if you're buying a compact drone that can fit. Also it's awesome if you have a camera!
customer_reviews.author: Sinan

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a camera bag to travel. A bag that can take my D800 with 28-300mm lens with hood, a 50mm with hood, a flash, 3 filters, and compartment to take my passport and pen. This one can take them all. I can put my water bottle instead of a tripod. It is light weight. I love it. The only drawback is that it is for right shoulder. I am a left shoulder man. But overall, it is almost perfect for my traveling need.
customer_reviews.author: F.L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new bag to replace the one that came with my camera. I don't have a lot of accessories and this is perfect for me! Love the purple on the inside and how the compartments are adjustable with the velcro pieces. It is a crossbody backpack and is extremely comfortable to wear. I'm so glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sling Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: I like the price point. It allowed to get into a sling camera bag without breaking the bank. It is great for organization of your camera gear and will allow comfortable transport for the day ahead. I am heading on a 6 week trip, look forward to using this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kidney

customer_reviews.title: Bag pictured is NOT the actual item received!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect for what I need, however, this bag does not include the rain cover as shown on the picture. If you need protection from rain for your equipment, this is not for you. If the rain cover is not important and the size is good enough for your needs, then go for it. The photos advertised are for a newer version of the bag and the item they sent me was an older version. Just glad they gave me partial credit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Best camera bag I have ever had! I have been shooting with 35mm and now digital so it's been a while! This bag allows me to take what I need and be very comfortable. My Sony A6300 and my favorite 3 lenses are with me all the time some time 4 lenses. I also attach a light tripod to the side and the straps keep it neat and in place.
customer_reviews.author: fish36

customer_reviews.title: There is perfection
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is relatively small but it is perfect, this is for people who want to carry everything a little but at the same time go light and comfortable, the weight of the backpack is almost not felt. It has lots of compartments, almost for everything. The rain cover is cherry pie.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeSalvador

customer_reviews.title: ample room, customizeable
customer_reviews.text: Very customizable. I will only be carrying a Nikon B700 and a GoPro 4 Silver. But then theres a lot to tack on for a day: extra batteries, tripods, back doors for the GoPro, more batteries, umbrella, maybe snacks. maps. Mobile phone, chargers, cords. Lots of room in this bag and there seems to be a pocket for everything you want to carry in camera terms.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Chambliss

customer_reviews.title: Cute bag
customer_reviews.text: After seeing so many bad reviews I still decide to buy this bag and I must say it’s really nice well constructed, lots of pockets n well padded added for camera protection I love it not sure how it will stand up against rain but I will spray it will a my waterproof spray for maximum protection
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: I like this bag
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag..I bought 2 for my cameras. I would like it more if the separators shown were actually apart of the bag vs having to be velcroed in.It does not fit exactly like whats in the picture. But it does have a lot of storage and its comfy when its on. Some things need to be improved but over all its a good bag
customer_reviews.author: Kimya Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Quality bag, but too small for my equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this item because it did not fit everything I needed to carry. For reference, I have a Canon 6D and I use the Canon 24-70 f/2.8 lens as well as my sigma 70-200 lens. I want to be able to carry both in my bag for portraits. It seemed too snug to carry the items.
customer_reviews.author: Xtuna

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Overall construction is very good. I was disappointed with the dividers included as I think they do not offer enough options for arrangement. I would alos like an option to change the side the pack sits on. I would prefer if the pack could be slung over my right shoulder but this unit only allows wearing it on the left.
customer_reviews.author: Mustava Dalilai

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for us
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for our camera and accessories . Only thing is you need a stable surface to open and access the camera or accessories as the whole thing opens as a flap. This worked out fine for the two of us but if you’re going to be alone it may cause a problem, especially if you’re out touring where no such surfaces are available.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: i love it
customer_reviews.text: good resistant material, light, perfect to put and walk long distances but not quite so resistant to rainwater, only that I do not buy the version that came with the rain cover, however I love it and I recommend it. If you buy the version with rain cover you would not have problems.. I recommend it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: cahilart

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Much nicer than I expected. Just wish they offered this w/out the purple interior. I love all the little pockets. I didn’t even realize it had the waterproof cover stored in the bottom pocket! I do plan on strapping my tripod to the side. It’s much bigger than the bag but it holds fine. Bag is a bit bulky, but I guess the padding is the better take away.
customer_reviews.author: MariskaGo

customer_reviews.title: Great camera bag for one body/two lenses
customer_reviews.text: I think this is really going to work out well for me, especially if the tripod straps will hold my tripod securely. I plan to carry by Z6 with one lens on it and a 70-200 beside it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barrentine

customer_reviews.title: Great bag! Plenty of room and secure.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bag! My son just borrowed it to go across country through many different weather conditions and it held up perfectly. It fits everything needed and secures all of my items well.
customer_reviews.author: Meeechelle

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Fit and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my first camera, easy to carry and customize, has extra clips for security and storage pockets. It’s super light for long hikes and holds all the necessities.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Took it with me for traveling and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Efren Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great for a day bag.
customer_reviews.text: Bag carried all of the needs for a day outing. But, the bag does not settle in on the shoulder very well. Large portion of the shoulder strap is small (short) forcing the bag to ride high on the back. Otherwise the strap cuts into the shoulder. Not good with a full bag.
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE L.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The bag came in handy for my trip thru Portugal and parts of Spain. I did a lot of walking and the bag was with me at all times. I was able to carry my canon camera and four lenses as well as its tripod and charger and maps a notebook and documents. Easy to carry light on the back and well designed, it takes a while to get used to the compartments when deploying the camera for an impromptu shot, but I admit that I am a novice at this so far. For a seasoned photographer and trekker, it should be an essential addition to the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bag! Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bag! Easy to use, lots of compartments. Worked perfectly for my trip to South Africa both holding my camera and other things needed like my wallet, a water bottle, phone, etc. The only strap did have an issue buckling that I had to work with, but minor compared to the usability of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie06

customer_reviews.title: Great camera bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy little camera bag. I love that you can just slide it from your back to the front, open the zipper and grab out your camera. I fit a small tripod in the side pocket, an extra lens, and other small items in here. It is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda A. Moran

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera bag for MEN. Not Women.
customer_reviews.text: Should have thought of the strap placement before purchasing. When wearing the bag as designed theres a strap that goes over your chest and an additional strap the clips in under the ribcage. This means if your a woman it clips under one of your boobs. If youre anything above a b cup its gonna look semi inappropriate. Without using the strap that goes under your boob the bag doesn't sit securely as cross body camera bag. bag itself is great quality though. loved all the separate compartments.
customer_reviews.author: Thalia Garcia

customer_reviews.title: it is a great small sling bag that I could carry all day ...
customer_reviews.text: Bag is well make and can hold my flash, two lenes and few small items. Unfortunately, my bag came with velcro installed on the wrong side of the large comparment (compare to the picture I saw on Amazon). Therefore, I have to put my camera with len faces toward my body and I felt awkward everytime when I try to reach for my camera. Otherwise, it is a great small sling bag that I could carry all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Chi Do

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I have used this daily since the purchase and it has saved my camera countless times! This bag is a great protective product for any camera!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda & Thomas Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Cushioning issue
customer_reviews.text: Received this bag yesterday, size is good. But Because of the way this is shipped it is stuffed into a box which causes the internal bottom cushion to bend and no longer have flat bottom on the case. Will be returning it and purchasing different one.
customer_reviews.author: jtolleth

customer_reviews.title: Outside awesome, inside poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited, but then I opened the box and found the bag was ripped inside. Hoping the replacement will be better. I'm a little worried it will not last my trip to Japan, inside material is poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki G

customer_reviews.title: A must for traveling with cameras
customer_reviews.text: Excelente construction, good quality material. The purple interior give the right contrast for find the small things. I use this bag for my Sony Nex 5N system (camera, 4 Lens, batteries, filters and some other things
customer_reviews.author: Robram

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bag for a couple months now and I have no complaints! It’s withstood a lot and has remained intact. This bag is amazing! I can fit all of my photography equipment into the many many different pockets and pouches. It’s amazing how much stuff I actually have in there. It’s very secure!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Kabala

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could take it to my son's marching band competitions. I needed something that would be easy to carry, allow me to store a few extra items in and be functional. This fits the bill, I am able to put my cell phone in the front pocket, and although I haven't used it yet I love that it has the rain protector stored in the case itself.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Santos

customer_reviews.title: The purple interior is very vibrant and pretty. Cons
customer_reviews.text: I am a semi-pro photographer that recently purchased this camera bag. Pros: it has a lot of pockets and storage options, including tiny pockets for sd cards. The purple interior is very vibrant and pretty. Cons: it's smaller than I had expected. The largest pocket isn't large enough for my dslr and lens. I have to take the lens off first. The strap for wearing the bag across your chest gets confusing to wear sometimes and it is difficult to swing the bad around to access the storage, line I had wanted. I wish I could return the item and spend a little more money for something I really wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Jamie Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Good small sling backpack.
customer_reviews.text: These camera backpacks work well as looking as you don't need a lot of equipment. You Have space for a camera and a couple lenses and some accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Shaw, CPS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Holds everything exactly like it's supposed to. Very light weight and good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Corsaw

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is wonderful and a great value! I have been taking my D7200 in a padded backpack but for summer travel wanted it to be more protected. It fits with tamron 70-300 lens attached (in the easy grab position) and there’s room for a couple more lenses. There are SO many pockets! And for those of you looking for the included rain cover, it’s hidden in a pocket on the very bottom. Bag is comfortable and lightweight when worn. Love this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is fantastic! It easily, and securely, holds everything I need. It's lightweight and easy to carry while being well padded. Love!
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great little bag
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome bag. My only constructive criticism is I with it came with additional foam dividers for a more custom set-up. I used additional dividers from other camera bags and achieved great organization.
customer_reviews.author: Brett hough

customer_reviews.title: Not Like the Picture
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with this bag. It looks nothing like the picture in the ad. It feels flimsy, not likely to be much protection for my gear. And it is small and will not hold the mirrorless outfit I got it for.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon L. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Don't put it down
customer_reviews.text: With this bag you can spin it around to the left and get into all the pockets while it is still slung over your shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg A. Iverson

customer_reviews.title: Loved It - Worth the small investment
customer_reviews.text: As a beginning photographer, this is my first camera bag and I love it. I didn't want to spend a lot of money without knowing what was really needed and this one is great. I'll be upgrading soon. Love the design and all the pockets. Easy to maneuver. I would definitely recommend. Good quality and sturdy material as well.
customer_reviews.author: KGillespie

product_meta.title: Qipi Camera Bag - Sling Bag Style Camera Case Backpack with Modular Inserts & Waterproof Rain Cover - for DSLR & Mirrorless Cameras (Nikon, Canon, Sony) - Black
product_meta.description:
SLING BAG STYLE CAMERA BACKPACK
Quick rotation from the back to the front of your body gives you FAST AND EASY ACCESS to your camera. Soft padded crossbody shoulder strap for MAXIMUM COMFORT for both men & women.

DESIGNED FOR PHOTOGRAPHERS
Holds your DSLR or mirrorless camera with a standard zoom lens and allows you to pack extra lenses or flash units. Comes with INCLUDED WATERPROOF RAIN COVER. The exterior also features a TRIPOD HOLDER.

MODULAR INTERIOR INSERTS
Compact form factor with large interior (10.6 x 9.4 x 5.9 inch LxWxH), featuring removable modular organizer inserts. CUSTOMIZE THE BAG AFTER YOUR NEEDS. Small COMPARTMENTS FOR ALL YOUR ESSENTIAL ACCESSORIES.

HIDDEN ANTI-THEFT POCKET
Safely store your valuables while in the outdoors or when you travel. Easily access your phone in the DEDICATED PHONE POCKET on the shoulder strap.

Details:
Weight: 1.7 pounds
Product dimensions: 16.1 x 10.2 x 6.7 inches
Main compartment dimensions: 10.6 x 9.4 x 5.9 inches
Material: Nylon

Package includes:
1 x Qipi Camera Slingbag DSLR Lens Bag Traveller Bag

Compability:
Compatible with Canon, Nikon, Sony, Olympus, Pentax and other DSLRs and photographic equipment.

Features:
- Sling bag and side open design
- DSLR lens and camera pocket
- Thief proof belt pocket
- Cell phone pocket
- Flash light pocket
- Memory card organizer
feature_bullets: SLING BAG STYLE CAMERA BACKPACK - Quick rotation from the back to the front of your body gives you FAST AND EASY ACCESS to your camera. Soft padded crossbody shoulder strap for MAXIMUM COMFORT for both men & women.

DESIGNED FOR PHOTOGRAPHERS - Holds your DSLR or mirrorless camera with a standard zoom lens and allows you to pack extra lenses or flash units. Comes with INCLUDED WATERPROOF RAIN COVER. The exterior also features a TRIPOD HOLDER.

MODULAR INTERIOR INSERTS - Compact form factor with large interior (10.6 x 9.4 x 5.9 inch LxWxH), featuring removable modular organizer inserts. CUSTOMIZE THE BAG AFTER YOUR NEEDS. Small COMPARTMENTS FOR ALL YOUR ESSENTIAL ACCESSORIES.
HIDDEN ANTI-THEFT POCKET - Safely store your valuables while in the outdoors or when you travel. Easily access your phone in the DEDICATED PHONE POCKET on the shoulder strap.
WHAT YOU GET: 1 x Qipi Camera Bag, 6 months 100% satisfaction guarantee warranty & friendly customer service.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,009 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
